page.title: 17Wiltshire in Winter.
page.content: In winter it is so cold sometimes that ice covers the river. Shallow ponds in fields freeze over. Children walk or skate on them. The ice can be up to 14 centimetres thick. Usually there is some snow after Christmas. If the wind blows, it makes deep drifts, especially where there are few trees and hedges. Some roads are blocked for days, until the snow plough comes and the roads are gritted and salted. West Overton school closed one day, because the teachers could not get there. Early in 1985 the snow was over six feet deep in the lane near West Overton church. The children went sledging on Gaston Hill, between Fyfield and the River Kennet. They couldn't play football or netball, so they built snowmen and had snowball fights instead.
